creator: ilia@paramon.ru
text:
I have the following setup:

NameVirtualHost *:80

<VirtualHost *:80>
ServerName www.amolini.tv
ServerAlias amolini.tv
</VirtualHost>

<VirtualHost *:80>
ServerName www.aloepole.ru
ServerAlias aloepole.ru
</VirtualHost>

<VirtualHost _default_:80>
#no ServerName here
</VirtualHost>

I expected to see sites www.amolini.tv, amolini.tv, www.aloepole.ru, 
aloepole.ru as usual, and other requests default to "_default_"

but instead of that I see sites www.aloepole.ru, aloepole.ru, amolini.tv
and www.amolini.tv goes to "_default_" section

Nope. You're confusing name based virtual hosts and ip based VHs. Try asking in
a user support forum.

Thanks for using Apache.
creator: nd@perlig.de
ilia@paramon.ru
text:
no, it's not about IP based virtual hosts.
it's all about name based virtual hosts.

VirtualHost _default_ works in unexpected way when "ServerAlias" present in 
other VirtualHosts.

creator: nick@webthing.com
text: Please reread the documentation of <VirtualHost>.  _default_ is meaningless in NameVirtualHosts, and always has been.
